name: jdc_person_id
title: JCOIN data commons person identifier
description: The generated unique identifier specific to the JCOIN Data Commons for a given individual (client or staff).

name: visit_number
title: Visit Number
description: A number that identifies the visit (survey administration event) or timepoint of data collection (baseline=1 and each subsequent follow up is 2 or greater).

name: shifted_visit_dt
title: Visit Date (shifted)
description: This is the date of the visit (ie time point of survey administration) after shifting by a random number 182 days before or 182 days after the actual visit date. The shifting is done on the individual level which retains the time interval between visits (and allows calculations of days between time points or other date fields which are shifted by the same number of days). To avoid issues with type conversion errors, the date is of type integer

name: visit_type
title: Visit Type
description: The visit type/category of the survey administration (either baseline or follow up)

name: or1
title: Confidence to implement
description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel confident that the organization can get people invested in implementing [intervention].]]
custom.jcoin:source:
Shea et al., 2014  - Organizational Readiness for Implementing Change: A psychometric assessment of a 
new measure.  Implementation Science 9:7. https://doi.org/10.1186/1748-5908-9-7

name: or2
title: Commitment to implement

name: oc1
title: Pressure
description: Rate each of the following items on a scale of 1-5 where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [Staff members are under too much pressure to do their jobs effectively]
custom.jcoin:source: TCU Survey of Organizational Functioning (Stress Measure)  - source document available at: http://ibr.tcu.edu/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/SOF-sg.pdf

name: sm1
title: MOUD Attitudes: Methadone
description: Based on your knowledge and personal experience, to what extent do you consider each of the following medications for opioid use disorder to be effective with justice-involved populations? (1=Not at all Effective, 7=Very Effective; provide   Don't know  option.) [Staff members are under too much pressure to do their jobs effectively]
constraints.enum: 1 Not at all Effective|2|3|4|5|6|7 Very Effective
